metadata.Title: CVE-2018-19497 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - medium.
metadata.Description: In The Sleuth Kit (TSK) through 4.6.4, hfs_cat_traverse in tsk/fs/hfs.c does not properly determine when a key length is too large, which allows attackers to cause a denial of service (SEGV on unknown address with READ memory access in a tsk_getu16 call in hfs_dir_open_meta_cb in tsk/fs/hfs_dent.c).

notes.Note: ebarretto> It looks like the versions in trusty and xenial are not affected.

criterions.comment: sleuthkit: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needed').
